intro: Sida graminifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a woolly texture, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Sida graminifolia is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in many regions.
